text: Parliamentary elections were held in Chile on 2 March 1969.Nohlen, D (2005) Elections in the Americas: A data handbook, Volume II, p262 The Christian Democratic Party lost their majority in the Chamber of Deputies, but remained the largest party in both houses. ==Electoral system== The term length for Senators was eight years, with around half of the Senators elected every four years. This election saw 25 of the 50 Senate seats up for election.1969 IPU ==Results== ===Senate=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !rowspan=2|Party !rowspan=2|Votes !rowspan=2|% !colspan=3|Seats |- !Elected !Total !+/– |- |align=left|Christian Democratic Party||345,248||34.3||11||23||+10 |- |align=left|Communist Party||181,488||18.0||3||9||+5 |- |align=left|Radical Party||173,386||17.2||4||6||–4 |- |align=left|National Party||160,875||16.0||4||5||–2 |- |align=left|Socialist Party||120,629||12.0||3||5||–2 |-| |align=left|Popular Socialist Union||24,423||2.4||0||0||New |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||–||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||1,006,049||100||25||50||+5 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout|| || ||–||–||– |- |align=left colspan=6|Source: Nohlen, IPU |} ===Chamber of Deputies=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Christian Democratic Party||716,547||31.1||56||–26 |- |align=left|National Party||480,523||20.8||33||+24 |- |align=left|Communist Party||383,049||16.6||22||+4 |- |align=left|Radical Party||313,559||13.6||24||+4 |- |align=left|Socialist Party||294,448||12.8||15||0 |- |align=left|Popular Socialist Union||51,904||2.3||0||New |- |align=left|National Democratic Party||44,818||1.9||0||–3 |- |align=left|Social Democrat Party||20,560||1.0||0||New |- |align=left|Independents||2,104||0.1||0||0 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||98,617||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||2,406,129||100||150||+3 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||3,244,892||74.2||–||– |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: Nohlen |} ==References== Category:Elections in Chile Category:1969 in Chile Chile Category:Presidency of Eduardo Frei Montalva Category:March 1969 events in South America
